content:
PlayReadyLicenseTemplate PlayReadyLicenseTemplate Class

Definition

Namespace:
Microsoft.WindowsAzure.MediaServices.Client.ContentKeyAuthorization
Assembly:
Microsoft.WindowsAzure.MediaServices.Client.dll

Represents a license template for creating PlayReady licenses to return to clients.

Edit

In this Article

[DataContract(Namespace = "http://schemas.microsoft.com/Azure/MediaServices/KeyDelivery/PlayReadyTemplate/v1")]
public class PlayReadyLicenseTemplate : IExtensibleDataObject<DataContract(Namespace:="http://schemas.microsoft.com/Azure/MediaServices/KeyDelivery/PlayReadyTemplate/v1")>
Public Class PlayReadyLicenseTemplate
    Implements IExtensibleDataObject
Inheritance
ObjectObject
PlayReadyLicenseTemplatePlayReadyLicenseTemplate
Attributes
DataContractAttribute

Inherited Members

System.Object

ToString()ToString()
Equals(Object)Equals(Object)

Constructors

PlayReadyLicenseTemplate() PlayReadyLicenseTemplate()

Edit 
public PlayReadyLicenseTemplate()Public Sub New
Attributes
DataContractAttribute

Properties

AllowTestDevices AllowTestDevices

Edit

Controls whether test devices can use the license or not. If true, the MinimumSecurityLevel property of the license is set to 150. If false (the default), the MinimumSecurityLevel property of the license is set to 2000.

[DataMember]
public bool AllowTestDevices { get; set; }<DataMember>
Public Property AllowTestDevices As Boolean
Value
Boolean Boolean
Attributes
DataMemberAttribute

BeginDate BeginDate

Edit

Configures the starting DateTime that the license is valid. Attempts to use the license before this date and time will result in an error on the client.

[DataMember(EmitDefaultValue = false)]
public DateTime? BeginDate { get; set; }<DataMember(EmitDefaultValue:=False)>
Public Property BeginDate As Date?
Value
Nullable<DateTime> Nullable(Of DateTime)
Attributes
DataMemberAttribute

ContentKey ContentKey

Edit

Specifies the content key in the license. This is typically set to an instance of the ContentEncryptionKeyFromHeader object to allow the template to be applied to multiple content keys and have the content header tell the license server the exact key to embed in the license issued to the client.

[DataMember(IsRequired = true)]
public PlayReadyContentKey ContentKey { get; set; }<DataMember(IsRequired:=True)>
Public Property ContentKey As PlayReadyContentKey
Value
PlayReadyContentKey PlayReadyContentKey
Attributes
DataMemberAttribute

ExpirationDate ExpirationDate

Edit

Configures the DateTime value when the the license expires. Attempts to use the license after this date and time will result in an error on the client.

[DataMember(EmitDefaultValue = false)]
public DateTime? ExpirationDate { get; set; }<DataMember(EmitDefaultValue:=False)>
Public Property ExpirationDate As Date?
Value
Nullable<DateTime> Nullable(Of DateTime)
Attributes
DataMemberAttribute

ExtensionData ExtensionData

Edit 
public virtual ExtensionDataObject ExtensionData { get; set; }Public Overridable Property ExtensionData As ExtensionDataObject
Value
ExtensionDataObject ExtensionDataObject
Attributes
DataContractAttribute

GracePeriod GracePeriod

Edit

Configures the Grace Period setting of the PlayReady license. This setting affects how DateTime based restrictions are evaluated on certain devices in the situation that the devices secure clock becomes unset.

[DataMember(EmitDefaultValue = false)]
public TimeSpan? GracePeriod { get; set; }<DataMember(EmitDefaultValue:=False)>
Public Property GracePeriod As TimeSpan?
Value
Nullable<TimeSpan> Nullable(Of TimeSpan)
Attributes
DataMemberAttribute

LicenseType LicenseType

Edit

Configures whether the license is persistent (saved in persistent storage on the client) or non-persistent (only held in memory while the player is using the license). Persistent licenses are typically used to allow offline playback of the content.

[DataMember]
public PlayReadyLicenseType LicenseType { get; set; }<DataMember>
Public Property LicenseType As PlayReadyLicenseType
Value
PlayReadyLicenseType PlayReadyLicenseType
Attributes
DataMemberAttribute

PlayRight PlayRight

Edit

Configures the PlayRight of the PlayReady license. This Right gives the client the ability to play back the content. The PlayRight also allows configuring restrictions specific to playback. This Right is required.

[DataMember]
public PlayReadyPlayRight PlayRight { get; set; }<DataMember>
Public Property PlayRight As PlayReadyPlayRight
Value
PlayReadyPlayRight PlayReadyPlayRight
Attributes
DataMemberAttribute

RelativeBeginDate RelativeBeginDate

Edit

Configures starting DateTime value when the license is valid. Attempts to use the license before this date and time will result in an error on the client. The DateTime value is calculated as DateTime.UtcNow + RelativeBeginDate when the license is issued

[DataMember(EmitDefaultValue = false)]
public TimeSpan? RelativeBeginDate { get; set; }<DataMember(EmitDefaultValue:=False)>
Public Property RelativeBeginDate As TimeSpan?
Value
Nullable<TimeSpan> Nullable(Of TimeSpan)
Attributes
DataMemberAttribute

RelativeExpirationDate RelativeExpirationDate

Edit

Configures the DateTime value when the license expires. Attempts to use the license after this date and time will result in an error on the client. The DateTime value is calculated as DateTime.UtcNow + RelativeExpirationDate when the license is issued

[DataMember(EmitDefaultValue = false)]
public TimeSpan? RelativeExpirationDate { get; set; }<DataMember(EmitDefaultValue:=False)>
Public Property RelativeExpirationDate As TimeSpan?
Value
Nullable<TimeSpan> Nullable(Of TimeSpan)
Attributes
DataMemberAttribute
